com.plexus.sam.event
Class EventScheduler

java.lang.Object
  com.plexus.sam.event.EventScheduler

public class EventScheduler
extends java.lang.Object

Generic EventScheduler class. To use extend BasicEvent, adding the scheduling policy and execution task. This class will keep the differen events ordered in a queue, and will schedule the next to be executed task in a Timer.

Author:
plexus

Field Summary
private  boolean active
          Switch that activates or deactivates this scheduler, see start(), stop()
private  java.util.PriorityQueue eventQueue
          The queue that stores the events
private  java.util.Timer eventTimer
          The timer that will execute every next event

          Default constructor

 void addEvent(BasicEvent e)
          Add an event to the queue.
 boolean removeEvent(BasicEvent e)
          Remove an event from the queue.
 void rescheduleEvent(BasicEvent event)
          This method should always be called when the Time property of an event changes, so the event can be rescheduled appropriatly.
private  void scheduleNext()
          Program the Timer to execute the next event.
 void start()
          Activate the scheduler
 void stop()

Constructor Detail

EventScheduler

Method Detail

addEvent

public void addEvent(BasicEvent e)
Add an event to the queue. If this changes the next to be scheduled event, then the timer is rescheduled to execute this new event.

Parameters:
e -

removeEvent

public boolean removeEvent(BasicEvent e)
Remove an event from the queue. If this is the frontmost event, then the next event is scheduled.

Parameters:
e -
Returns:
true if the event was in the queue

rescheduleEvent

public void rescheduleEvent(BasicEvent event)
This method should always be called when the Time property of an event changes, so the event can be rescheduled appropriatly.

Parameters:
event -

scheduleNext

private void scheduleNext()
Program the Timer to execute the next event.

start

public void start()
Activate the scheduler

stop

public void stop()
Deactivate the scheduler
